snippet: Criticism of the minor part played by Americans in a rally against terrorism has stung President Obama’s staff.
abstract: Josh Earnest, White House press secretary, responds to questions about why Pres Obama did not attend peace march in Paris and also failed to send official of appropriate high rank in his place; Earnest acknowledges that administration made mistake and that decision was not made by Obama.

byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from Ahmedabad, India.

lead_paragraph: Criticism of the minor part played by Americans in a rally against terrorism has stung President Obama’s staff.

headline.main: White House Acknowledges Error in Not Sending a Top Official to March in Paris
headline.print_headline: White House Acknowledges Error in Not Sending a Top Official to March in Paris
